item.title: JavaScript's prototype chain
item.description: #JavaScript #Prototype JavaScript is often referred to as a prototype-based language. Prototype literally means prototype. Every object you create with JavaScript is paired with a prototype, i.e. a prototype object. Using this structure, inheritance, one of the important concepts in Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) using C++, can be easily implemented in JavaScript as well. In JavaScript, this is called a ‘prototype chain’. To understand the prototype chain, you first need to get a feel for the prototype object.
